intro: Carex bigelowii, commonly known as Bigelow’s sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and grass-like leaves. This plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Its flowering structures, called spikelets, are usually borne in dense clusters at the top of the plant. Carex bigelowii plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
